newsitem.title: USA: BPA offers daytime power for Thurs at $13-14/MWh.
newsitem.headline: BPA offers daytime power for Thurs at $13-14/MWh.

text.p: Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) resumed offering non-firm surplus power during some on-peak hours for Thursday, the agency said Wednesday.

BPA offered non-firm power during hours ending 1200-1800 PDT at $14.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for Northwest deliveries and $15.00 for Califoria-Oregon border (COB). No volume limit was placed on the offers.
Thursday prices for non-firm power for hours ending at 0600 PDT and 2300 PDT were unchanged at $9.50 for all deliveries, while prices for hours ending 0100-0500 PDT and 2400 PDT were steady at $9.00.
Firm power during off-peak hours on Thursday was also unchanged at $9.00 per MWh.
